reviews.review:
Only way to enjoy the game is with friends or in Workshop Public Servers.

Competitive is full of toxic players, smurfs, or griefers. Some people will say the game itself is good, but the community is what is bad. That is a misunderstanding: The people define the game, so for all practical purposes, the community IS the game.

Play only if you like the competitive pain like me. But do not expect fun.

Literally One Of My Favourite Games Of All Times

This game is amazing and is undeniably one of the best FPS Multyplayer shooters out there.
It is pretty much undying at this point and it's one of the most Played/Streamed games in the world ever since 2012 and nowadays still gets around 20 million monthly players.
There are still plenty of bug fixes, new maps, new cases, and new patches and sometimes new weapons released.
Contrary to other AAA FPS games such as Overwatch Or Rainbow Six The ranking system uses ELO where you get points from each games and know when you're going to rank up but in CS:GO it is sort of a suprise each time and it's as enjoyable and satisfying every single time.

Very fun game! Now only if we can get the toxicity level and cheating level down to a minimum, we would really have something special. I started playing Condition Zero 10+ years ago, switched to CS1.6, then to CSS, now CSGO. So I am a veteran that started from the beginning.
